conclusion: Consider contributions from each of the four point charges at the vertices of the square.
Place the square in the coordinate system with specific coordinates for A, B, C, D.
The intersection of the diagonals is at (L/2, L/2) and distance from center to any vertex is L√2/2.
Electric field due to a point charge q at distance r is E = kq/r².
Calculate electric field due to charge at A with magnitude and direction.
Calculate electric field due to charge at B with magnitude and direction.
Calculate electric field due to charge at C with magnitude and direction.
Calculate electric field due to charge at D with magnitude and direction.
Sum the components of electric fields from all charges to find total x and y components.
Total electric field at the center is (0, 0).
Electric field strength at the intersection of the diagonals is 0.
